Residency Programs
If you are a ML/AI enthusiast, have you ever thought what could be the best way to kickstart your career at leading tech companies like Google, Microsoft or Facebook? Well! A residency program could be your dream opportunity that you always wanted to be a part of. The demand for AI talents is growing faster than ever. A number of industry leaders, leading tech companies, research institutions and emerging tech platforms offer AI residency programs designed to help nurture promising AI talents.
AI residency programs are aimed at identifying young AI talents and train them to become the future leaders in various areas of AI. Within the stipulated duration of residency, residents are expected to contribute to all aspects of research projects, including idea inception, experiment design, and implementation, and writing and presenting research work at top-tier conferences in AI. Residents are also closely mentored by research scientists and will also gain hands-on research experience at an international level, which will open the door to a wide range of opportunities in their future careers while residents at many companies will get fulltime opportunities.
Get ready to explore the residency programs of 2021!
Google AI Residency Program
The Google AI Residency Program is a 18-month research training role designed to jumpstart or advance your career in machine learning research.
The Google AI Residency Program was created in 2015 with the goal of training and supporting the next generation of deep learning researchers. With machine learning fast becoming a critical area for a broad range of applications, we recognized the need to evolve our research goals and expand beyond deep learning to include a breadth of machine learning subfields. People from a wide range of disciplines are beginning to realize the importance and impact of this area of research. With growing interest in the field, there is a corresponding need for researchers with hands-on experience in machine learning techniques and methodologies.
Residents will have the opportunity to be mentored by distinguished scientists and engineers from various teams within Google AI, and work on real-world machine learning problems and applications. In addition, they will also have the opportunity to collaborate and partner closely with various research groups across Google and Alphabet.
The Google AI Residency Program is primarily based in Mountain View, California. Residents will also have the opportunity to be based in New York, Cambridge (Massachusetts), Seattle (Washington), Montreal, Toronto, Zurich (Switzerland), Berlin (Germany), Accra (Ghana) and Tel Aviv (Israel) depending on project fit and availability.
Any students(BS, MS or PhD) graduating in the year 2021 is eligible to apply and applications will open in December, 2020.
Facebook AI Residency Program:
The Facebook Artificial Intelligence Residency(FAIR) Program is a one-year research training position designed to give you hands-on experience with artificial intelligence research while working in Facebook AI.
The program will pair you with an AI Researcher and Engineer who will both guide your project. With the team, you will pick a research problem of mutual interest and then devise new deep learning techniques to solve it. The program also encourages collaborations beyond the assigned mentors. The research will be communicated to the academic community by submitting papers to top academic venues (for example, NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, CVPR, ICCV, ACL, EMNLP, etc.), as well as open-source code releases and/or product impact.
The program encourages applications from people who have a strong technical background and are passionate about AI research.
Facebook on May 6th, 2020 announced that it plans to cancel its 2020-2021 in-person AI Residency program as a result of the novel coronavirus pandemic. Further announcements related to upcoming residency programs are yet to be released.
Microsoft AI Residency Program
The Microsoft AI Residency program is a 12-month role designed to advance careers in machine learning research and engineering. Residents will have the opportunity to work alongside prominent researchers and engineers in either Redmond, WA, or Cambridge, UK. They will build skills and get hands-on experience working on practical AI and machine learning problems that help tackle some of society’s toughest challenges.
A diverse range of researchers, engineers, and applied scientists with unique perspectives are encouraged to apply, including candidates who may not have a traditional background in AI, but who are passionate about working on AI technologies to solve real-world challenges.
Microsoft will start accepting applications for its AI Residency Program from December, 2020.
Sunstone Eduversity
Business schools are expensive and ROI of an MBA is not promising for many students and we all know how much of an impact education loan debts can have on a young professional’s life. As a result even in the past 3 years we can see the declining number of students enrolling for B-schools
Sunstone Eduversity is the “Pay Fee Only After You Get A Job India's only Pay After Placement Management Program”.
Founded in 2015, Sunstone Eduversity has a clear vision of creating industry-ready professionals and imparting knowledge and skills based on the present demands of the industry.
Yes, you heard it right! It is the first university offering management courses where students pay their fees to college only once they get placed during their final year. Once a student is placed, the student needs to pay 10 times their Monthly Gross Salary as the Tuition Fees (Pre-Incentives) to Sunstone Eduversity after their placement. The university also has a Money-Back Guarantee Program where the fees will be completely refundable if the student does not get placed within 3 months of graduation.
Interesting, right? Sunstone eduversity is truly changing the education industry and students right now are in need of such programs only which can give the promisable future to the students.
